Question: You are waiting at a railway level crossing and the red lights continue to flash after the train has passed. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on carefully while the lights are still flashing
Stay stopped until the lights stop flashing
Check both ways and then drive on
Wait for 15 seconds and then drive on

Question: What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
Fire hydrant

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: This sign means the speed for safe and comfortable driving around the curve is 35km/h.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What must you do when you see blue and red flashing lights behind you?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Slow down and drive on carefully
Slow down and stop
Drive on as usual

Question: You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?

Answers.Answer: A
B
C
D

Question: What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: You are driving downhill on a steep, narrow road and a vehicle is coming up the hill. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Pull over to the left and give way to the vehicle coming up the hill
Flash the headlights of your vehicle at the vehicle coming up the hill
Sound the horn of your vehicle to get the vehicle coming up the hill out of the way
Do nothing, the vehicle coming up the hill should give way to you

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead without stopping
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: If your car was first registered before 1 January 2000, you must renew its warrant of fitness every:

Answers.Answer: 3 months
6 months
9 months
12 months

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer
No – not at all

Answers.Answer: A
B
C
D

Answers.Answer: 20km/h
25km/h

50km/h

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?

Answers.Answer: 4 metres
5 metres
6 metres
7 metres

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back
have its hazard lights on
be sounding its horn
be travelling slower than 50km/h

Question: When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:

Answers.Answer: 8pm to 6am
10pm to 5am
10pm to 6am
11am and 7am

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up within 2 hours
Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely
Sweep it up within 24 hours
Tell a police officer

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?

Answers.Answer: An ambulance officer
A doctor
A member of the public
A police officer
